docs.text: there's a 1 , 000-foot tidal wave at the end of deep impact .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'd say it pretty accurately represents the towering flood of the last two years worth of disaster movies , which are getting more irwin allen- esque with every release .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the early wave of this revival , while just as cheesy and laughable , at least knew to include thrills every five to ten minutes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: deep impact tries to disguise itself as a human drama , with endless filler comprised of disaster prevention plans the country keeps taking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the repeating cycle is as follows -- the president ( morgan freeman ) will go on tv and tell the country that there's a remote chance a comet will strike the earth , but that the nation's crack scientists and astronauts have some brilliant plan to stop the problem .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then we get to see the plan in action , in some sequence utterly lacking suspense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the mission will barely fail , and freeman will tell the country that the comet is still headed toward earth , and there's a remote chance it will strike , but that the nation's crack scientists and astronauts have some brilliant plan to stop the problem .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it goes on and on throughout the movie , but every time freeman goes on tv , we know his plan is going to fail .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how do we know this ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: because we've seen the tv ads for deep impact , ads that feature freeman telling the nation that " the comet is still headed right for us " and show disaster shots of the comet striking earth and the giant tidal wave spreading .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ladies and gentlemen , that is the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: successful disaster movies have the main disaster toward the beginning and more little disasters that follow , but deep impact saves its one disaster for the end and discloses all in its 30-second tv spots .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: television is what's wrong with deep impact .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the main character , played by tea leoni , is a low-level broadcast journalist for msnbc ( and that's the mere tip of the product-placement iceberg ) who stumbles upon a huge government conspiracy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she thinks it's an instance of an ex-secretary of something or other ( james cromwell ) resigning because of a mistress , and that maybe he took the fall for the president in the same area .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when she goes nosing around cromwell , he begs her to keep it under wraps .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " i know you're just a reporter , but you used to be a human being . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she figures out what's really going on after getting roughed up by some fbi men and doing an internet search , where all good journalists learn the difference between a mistress and an extinction- level comet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: upon a top-secret meeting with president freeman , leoni agrees to keep the story under wraps until the president can hold a press conference , at which she gets to ask the first question .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and everyone knows , if you get to ask the first question , baby you're a star .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: leoni ends up in the anchor chair , broadcasting every step of the comet's collision course with earth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and i'm sure it's comforting for her to know that , even though the world's ending in a matter of months , she's a cable news personality .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so there she is , narrating the six-astronaut mission to blow the comet up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: such personalities as robert duvall , jon favreau and blair underwood cash their paychecks and go through the motions of this dragged-out process .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but as anyone who's seen the commercials knows , the astronauts fail .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they only end up breaking the comet into two pieces , which means even more destruction to the earth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yeah , thanks , nasa .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's when freeman has to come on tv for the last time and say goodbye to all the people who aren't picked to live in the missouri cave site for two years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they even have animals , two by two , ready to climb into the cave .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if the focus had been on people living inside these caves after the world had been destroyed , deep impact could have been a far more interesting movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead we watch as a lovestruck elijah wood defies all odds to chase down his young wife , while people pack the highways out of town .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the reasoning is , of course , that if a comet is going to strike , they might as well be out in some scenic rural location .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and , amusingly , the highway is spotted with people in u-haul trucks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm sure it's comforting to know that , even though the world's ending in a matter of minutes , the u-haul people are doing the most business of their lives .
docs.label: negative
